data.name: New Minglewood Wheat
data.description: Our American Style Wheat is a beer with a light, crisp body, balanced by delicate flavors and aromas from the American-style yeast.  The pilsner and wheat malt combine for a light golden body with a touch of Vienna malt to add complexity to the finish.  American C-type hops provide subtle citrus flavors to the finish.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager without Yeast
style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. A fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Appearance can be clear or with chill haze, golden to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is packaged and served without yeast, no yeast characters should be evident in mouthfeel, flavor, or aroma.

data.name: No Shame
data.description:
Don’t apologize if what you do is right.

And if what you’re doing right is drink good beer, then have No Shame. This beer isn’t the biggest or the hoppiest beer known to mankind, nor will the beer geeks ever age it for a bottle share. But it is good beer, that’s all that matters!

No Shame is a wheat beer. This beer is a great summer beer or a great beer if your summer never ends. Light body with touches of wheat that adds smooth creamy notes with hops that make this a great drinker! Drink this proud . . . There’s No Shame

breweries.name: Gella's Diner & Lb. Brewing Company
breweries.description:
A native of the rural western Kansas community of Brownell, Gerald Wyman and his wife, Janet, raised two daughters and lived the typical rural farming and ranching lifestyle. But following his children’s graduation from high school, Gerald sold the cattle and leased the land. All for his love of beer.

It wasn’t a side effect of empty-nest syndrome or a midlife crisis. Janet, who endured her husband’s brewing experiments in her kitchen for years, finally banned Gerald’s brewing operations to the garage where he set up a larger operation and brewed the first of his award winning home brews. Realizing Gerald had a great talent, the couple decided to open a microbrewery in nearby Hays.

The Wymans planned to open their microbewery in a strip mall. That is until they met Chuck Comeau. Chuck is a rural entrepreneur whose innovative talents led to the creation of the Dessin Fournir Companies, six luxury goods firms whose clientele includes Hollywood’s elite, media moguls and royalty.

data.name: Nutcracker
data.description: As The Horny Goat’s second seasonal brew, the Nutcracker was created in the tradition of Bavarian Holiday Wheat Bocks. By adding just a touch of smoked malt (or rauchmalz), this technique creates a smooth, well balanced yet complex flavor, perfect for sipping fire-side on a cold winter day. While tasting the Nutcracker, look for a hint of smokiness on the palate to follow your swallow.

breweries.name: Horny Goat Brewing Company
breweries.description: We’re often questioned about the origin of our name. Our story has it that “Spanish Fly Brewing” sounded too clumsy. Another says it was a bet at a card game. A third we’ve been advised by our lawyers not to discuss. While each rendition may have some truth to it, what it really boils down to is quite simple: Beer is fun. Brewing is fun. Drinking beer with your buddies is fun. So, why not a name that’s fun? After all, we’re in the business of helping people enjoy life. And we take our business very seriously. Our beers are craft-brewed for Old World taste and new world refreshment. Savored, slammed or sipped,these beers are also brewed to be sold and we plan on selling a lot of them. Aggressive marketing campaigns are in place to make sure Horny Goat Beers are on the radar of beer purchasers in select markets. Radio commercials, point-of-sale, guerilla tactics, swag, social media, you name it ‘cause we plan on growing, and growing large quickly. Kind of like a horny goat. So prepare yourself, the world is about to become a much hornier place.

breweries.name: Fortnight Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We believe that beer is a social beverage and good beer should be enjoyed with good friends. That is why we aim to bring a line of clean easy-drinking English inspired ales that everyone can enjoy to the Triangle area in late 2013. 

We love beer with extreme flavors or high alcohol content as much as the next guy, but that's not for everyone, which is why we will be producing extremely balanced and flavorful beers at a lower alcohol level that will be easily approachable and everyone will be able to find a beer that they enjoy in our lineup.

Fortnight Brewing is a true partnership of local and English flavors. The company's ownership consists of both English citizens and North Carolina natives, and our beers will utilize premium English malts and hops as well as locally-grown ingredients. 

Fortnight Brewing will be located in Cary NC with plans of opening in Summer or Fall of 2013. Keep your eyes open for a list of upcoming tasting events at your favorite area bottle shops, bars and restaurants!

breweries.name: Union Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

breweries.name: 903 Brewers
breweries.description:
903 Brewers was founded on a simple idea; make great beer for a great community. With that idea in mind Jeremy and Natalie Roberts began building the foundation for 903 Brewers back in 2011.
 
Jeremy Roberts is not only the founder but also the head brewer. He spent years perfecting his recipes and letting the community decide what beers they wanted from their local brewery. He fearlessly concocted hundreds of different beers to see what new flavors he might come up with. Not all were a hit, but that is how you find a gem. Do you have an idea for a beer you’d like to try? Let him know, he just might try it out.
 
903 Brewers officially opened its doors in June of 2013 and introduced to the world The Chosen One Coconut Ale and Roo’s Red Ale. Since that time they have released many new and exciting beers. Starting fall of 2014 you will be able to find their beers in 22oz bombers.

breweries.name: Pennsylvania Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Penn Brewery has been producing high-end craft beers since 1986.  Penn’s flagship lineup features authentic German-style beers brewed in the tradition of Pittsburgh’s German immigrants, according to the strict quality standards of Reinheitsgebot.  
More recently, our lineup has been expanded to include other varieties including APAs, IPAs, fruit beers, and more.  The common thread that binds all of Penn’s beers together, however, is exceptional quality and craftsmanship.  We produce all of our brews in the classic, old-world way, without taking any shortcuts. We use copper kettles for optimal heat control. We employ double-decoction grain mashing to release fuller flavor in our lagers.  And we lager all of our beers in horizontal tanks for a cleaner, crisper finish. 

Penn Brewery is housed in the mid-nineteenth century landmark E&O Brewery building and is one of only a handful of working breweries with original beer caves still on premise.  And with our commitment to brewing the old-world way, we like to say that here at Penn Brewery, the tradition of our lagering caves lives on.

breweries.name: Chelsea Alehouse
breweries.description:
Located in Chelsea’s historic Clocktower Complex, the Chelsea Alehouse Brewery opened its doors in December 2012.  Featuring American and English style Ales, we aim to provide a wide variety of choices for the beer connoisseur and occasional beer drinker as well.

In our pub, enjoy a view of our American-made tanks at the bar, get cozy in a booth or enjoy a pint outside in our beer garden.  Our deli-style kitchen features delicious grilled sandwiches, wraps, housemade hummus and salsa, or try our meat cheese plate featuring local cheeses.

We’re family friendly with menu options for kids and have changing tables in both our restrooms.

breweries.name: Flatrock Brewing Company
breweries.description: Not very many people know about the pre-prohibition brewing traditions of Northwest Ohio. Many communities had their very own brewery selling quality beers to thirsty local customers. Flatrock Brewing Cmopany would like to continue this tradition by offering local high quality micro brewed beers. Flatrock Brewing Company produces beers using fresh grain and locally sourced ingredients including honey and seasonal fruits. With the brewery expansions we also plan on hiring local brewery employees and sales people.

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

breweries.name: Carlton and United Breweries
breweries.description:
Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of the most iconic beer companies in Australia with our history going back to 1824. 

We brew some of Australia’s most famous beers, including Victoria Bitter, Carlton Draught, Cascade, Crown Lager, Melbourne Bitter, Pure Blonde, Foster’s, Matilda Bay, as well as ciders including Strongbow, Mercury, and Bulmers.

CUB originally formed in 1907 as Carlton & United Breweries, the name we still hold today. In 2011, we became part of the SABMiller group, the second largest brewer in the world, returning to our heritage and core strength as a brewer.

Our alcohol beverage sales team services over 17,000 customers across the on-premise and off-premise channels and our national brewing, logistics and sales network delivers to over 20,000 customers including hotels, clubs, liquor stores, restaurants and bars.

We are committed to building this great business, CUB, into the most admired company in the Australian beverage sector.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

data.name: Red House Wheat
data.description: The Red House Wheat is a delicious American-style wheat beer with delicate cherry and plum flavors. With a dry finish and subtle fruit characteristics, Red House will be your new favorite beer. It's light at 4.3 % ABV and wonderfully refreshing.

breweries.name: Birdsong Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Birdsong was founded in 2011 with a quest for better beer and a 5 gallon soup kettle. Our vision is similar to many of our favorite craft brewing mentors who have inspired us to open our own brewery: We strive to brew flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers for distribution in the Charlotte, NC area.  
 
We are located in NoDa at 26th & North Davidson and we started retail distribution and tap room sales in December 2011.  Our goal is to create outstanding beer, to have a low impact on the environment, and to create personal relationships and ties to the local community. 
 
Our inspiration comes from the popular and innovative styles of the West Coast brewers and is fueled by Conor's Passion and ability to construct unique yet sessionable recipes.  We're excited to add to the growing craft beer movement in Charlotte and the Carolinas.

data.name: Rock Ryder
data.description:
Named for White Rock Lake and the cyclists who loop it, Rock Ryder is a refreshing, crowd-pleasing, session beer. But just because it's easy drinking doesn't mean it's got training wheels.

With peppery notes from rye malt, a rocky head and a dry finish, our American Rye Wheat pulls ahead of the pack. Sit back and enjoy the Ryde.

data.name: Snapshot
data.description: Snap! You just captured an unfiltered wheat beer full of refreshment and a flash of tart at the finish. Smile-inducing aromas of citrus hops jump from the nose, accompanied by the sweetness of coriander and grains of paradise. Brewed with wheat and pale malt, Snapshot pours a hazy, lemon-yellow with bright-white lacing. But the real enticement is the snap of tart. New Belgium’s affinity for sour beers led to the in-process blending of lactobacillus to pucker up Snapshot’s base. An extra step to acidify and beautify and get this beer ready for its close up.

breweries.name: New Belgium Brewing
breweries.description: We'll set the scene: 1989. Belgium. Boy on bike. (OK, make that a young man of 32). As our aspiring young homebrewer rides his mountain bike with fat tires through European villages famous for beer, New Belgium Brewing Company was but a glimmer in his eye. Or basement. For Jeff Lebesch would return to Fort Collins with a handful of ingredients and an imagination full of recipes. And then there was beer. Jeff's first two basement-brewed creations? A brown dubbel with earthy undertones named Abbey and a remarkably well-balanced amber he named Fat Tire. To say the rest was history would be to overlook his wife's involvement. Kim Jordan was New Belgium's first bottler, sales rep, distributor, marketer and financial planner. And now, she's our CEO.

data.name: Solace
data.description: Firestone Walker presents Solace, an ode to warmer weather in the northern hemisphere. A hint of citrus fruit and clove aroma are followed by tangy dry malt flavor and a silky finish making it an approachable and refreshing session beer. Ideal for washing down fish tacos or other south o’ the border-inspired dishes.

breweries.name: Lost Rhino Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lost Rhino™ is a new craft brewery in Ashburn, VA with deep roots in Loudoun County. Brewers Matt Hagerman and Favio Garcia, formerly of Old Dominion, are back together and now creating some of the finest beers found in the local area!

The name Lost Rhino™ represents the strength and attitude of the rhinoceros. The five species of rhino each has its own distinct persona, ranging from laid back to aggressive. Our brews will also span a range of personalities from hoppy Pilsners to rich, malty IPAs.

"Rhino chasers" are big wave surfers on a continuous journey to find the next perfect wave. At Lost Rhino™, we are on a similar journey to create a continuing line of distinctive, enjoyable, memorable beers.

breweries.name: John A. Huber Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The John A Huber Brewing Company is a family owned and operated business. Here, brewing is family

"The concept for John A. Huber Brewing Company was set in motion in 1984 with the dreams of Missouri farmboy John Huber as he tasted his first home-brewed beer. In 2003, John received a home-brew kit for Christmas from his wife and sons. It was at that moment the Huber Brew or "Hubrew", the Company's flagship beer, was born. In 2009, he opened up Homebrew Supply of Southeast Missouri, LLC in Jackson, Missouri. In 2011, the John A. Huber Brewing Company took root in Fruitland, Missouri. The Company is a family owned and operated business. John's sons, Matthew and Chad, assist their father in the Company's operation. John and his family have lived in Southeast Missouri all their lives. They want to share their passion for brewing, their sense of community and their comradery. Come join them."

Hubrew is a packaging brewery. We do not currently have any onsite sales or tours.

data.name: Sparky
data.description:
Our garage was a pretty crowded space. Toys, tools, brewing equipment, and even the family sedan when we could fit it in. Probably no different than your garage. So with space at a premium, there was no room for junk. Everything had to perform. Like that pair of jumper cables over there. When we need them, they get the job done, providing a spark to start something fresh, something new, shared among family, friends, even a stranger in need. So here’s to providing a spark when called upon, no matter who needs it. That’s why we call this this hoppy wheat ale Sparky. And always remember, red to positive.

Sparky Hoppy Wheat Ale is a true-to-style American wheat beer. Unlike the common German Hefeweizen which features banana and clove yeast aromas and flavors, this beer features a clean American ale yeast. This single Cascade hop brewed beer focuses on being hop forward with a nice malt background support the hops and keep the beer well-balanced. This hop is citrus and pine forward. Sparky finishes dry, clean and crisp.

breweries.name: Braxton Brewing Company
breweries.description:
At Braxton, a garage is more than a garage. It’s a place where we build our hopes and dreams, storing them on the wall neat as garden tools. Really, the garage is a hub. A reliable place from which we launch into the world, and enjoy a safe return.

We hang out in our garages. Saturday mornings, afternoons, long into the night. Sometimes hosting neighbors, family and friends, other times in blissful solitude, tinkering on projects, obsessing over a problem or making something great. Think of the garages in your past. You’ll remember your dad fishing a lawnmower or building a table, where he taught you to say “Yes, sir.” You can almost smell the oil and beer.

But more and more the family garage is an incubator, an enterprise zone. It’s part of the beautiful renaissance happening in the middle of this great country. So it was for Evan Rouse. Evan, from Union, Kentucky, was a pretty extraordinary kid. Because while other kids played video games and started garage bands, Evan fell in love with the craft of brewing beer. And he built a home brewery in the family garage. He was just 16 years old, not even of age.

For Evan, brewing beer was more than an idea, it was a revolution. Because from that humble start, Evan’s love for brewing has become his entrepreneurial obsession. He’s building the brewery of his dreams. And his entire family is on board, helping him get it done. (The truth is, it’s a pretty extraordinary family.)

So welcome to Braxton Brewing Company. You’re witnessing a dream coming to life. A place where ideas are born and fermented. It’s a great deal of work, but hell, that’s what makes a dream worth pursuing. This brewery celebrates determination, knowledge, and the humble pride we wave like a battle flag.

breweries.name: Old Black Bear Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Our decision to start brewing beer and sharing it with the public came from our desire to create a great beer that real people can not only enjoy, but also relate to. Some beer companies try to market their beer as being able to bring you a life of leisure; others may try to convince you that higher alcohol content automatically means better beer; others may simply try to sell you beer of poor quality and claim, "It's a craft beer." People know better than that, and our goal is to make great beer and sell it at a fair price without using silly marketing gimmicks.

Old Black Bear is not able to bring you a carefree life. If we could, we are undercharging for our product. However, what we can do is this: Provide you with a beverage that you can enjoy with your friends after a hardworking day, and assure you that every Old Black Bear Beer you drink will be of the highest quality and offer you drinkability and refreshment that is unmatched by any other small craft brewery ~ a real life beer you deserve.

breweries.name: Rhinegeist
breweries.description:
Rhinegeist is a brewery out of Cincinnati, OH that was built within the skeleton of the old Moerlein bottling plant (built in 1895). Within these unique and historic walls, we brew 20bbl batches of beer that sings with flavor and delights us. The yin/yang of our brewing philosophy is hoppy/sessionable and we aim to brew beers where “the first sip calls for the third”.  We’re a small team with big dreams and tend to smile while we sweat. We brew those styles which are most compelling to our thirst and we certainly hope you enjoy our brews as much as we do.

Rhinegeist means “ghost of the Rhine”, and refers to our place here in the historic Brewery District in the Over the Rhine neighborhood of Cincinnati. At the turn of the century, this neighborhood was home to nearly 45,o00 inhabitants, most of them of German descent and 38 breweries. We hope to engender the spirit of camaraderie and hard work that we imagine those living and brewing in this neighborhood at that time embodied.

We self distribute our beer, which means each beer that you drink in a bar or restaurant is poured from a keg that we delivered cold in our refrigerated van (keep your eyes peeled for it around town). We like to keep beer as fresh as possible, which means that every keg we fill is immediately moved into cold storage where it sits until we load it onto our refrigerated van for delivery to the coldbox of each local account. Fresh beer is tasty beer, and that’s our favorite kind.

breweries.name: All Saints Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All Saints Brewing Company is a new craft brewery in Greensburg, PA. Our mission is to build a brand focused on selling locally manufactured craft beer, for beer people, by beer people. Consistently good tasting craft beer, brewed locally and with Western Pennsylvania pride and passion.

Our brew house is a 7 bbl system which was originally installed at the Red Star Brewery in Greensburg, PA. The system was expanded when brought to All Saints Brewing Company. This expansion allows us additional capacity in addition to providing the opportunity to brew a number of diverse craft brews along with seasonal specialties and Jeff’s world famous barley wines.

breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.

breweries.name: Wachusett Brewing Company
breweries.description: History Wachusett Brewery founders Ned, Kevin and Peter developed a significant appreciation for beer while attending Worcester Polytechnic Institute. Adventures in biking, canoeing, and hiking that led the trio to the northern New England states allowed them to visit some of the first operating craft breweries. Armed with a we can do this attitude the three cast off from their careers in engineering and biology to found the Wachusett Brewing Co. in 1993. Wachusett Country Ale was introduced to beer fans of Massachusetts the next year after lots of experimenting to get the formula just right. When Wachusett opened, the three designed and built most of the equipment; did the brewing and filling, selling and delivering, and everything else that a small startup brewery needed. Ned, Kevin and Peter are now backed by some of the most passionate and capable co-workers in the industry. Wachusett Ales continue to be hand crafted with the finest ingredients available, bottled and kegged in our Westminster facility. The three have never strayed from their plan to brew and sell the freshest, highest quality beers possible.

breweries.name: CJ's Brewing Company
breweries.description: At CJ's, we're all about the beer. Enjoy our great brews and ales along with a delicious meal.  Watch the brewmaster as he prepares some of the six fresh brews we have on tap daily in the brewing room.  In season, slip out the back door and enjoy your beer and dine on our open air patio. Our menu offers a wide variety of delicious and creative beer- friendly dishes made with the freshest ingredients.

data.name: Summer Honey Wheat
data.description: When we first opened our doors in 1995, our summer seasonal was one of the first beers we brewed. Back then, we called it Honey Blonde Ale, and it was a favorite of baseball fans coming to a game during the heat of the Colorado summer. It took an extended summer break in 1999, reappearing in 2006 in time to win a Gold Medal at the Great American Beer Festival® under the name Blue Moon Honeymoon in the Specialty Honey Lager or Ale Category. and then again in 2010 as Blue Moon® Summer Honey Wheat Ale. And now, to answer the plea of our adoring fans, we’re bringing it back, once again, for the summer of 2014.

So please watch for us in your neighborhood.
